meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Joe Koster Megan Benitz Katie Proctor Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6225.

td.p: Joe Koster, a telephone technician from Pelham, New Hampshire
Megan Benitz, a museum registrar from Wathena, Kansas
Katie Proctor, a stay-at-home mom from Hendersonville, North Carolina (whose 2-day cash winnings total $51,201)

tr.td: HOME FROM THE HOUSE
SHOP TALK
YOU'LL NEED SOME BACKUP
AT 33
THE PLANETS
INSIDE OUTSIDE
(Alex: Each correct response will be made up of letters in the word "outside".)

(Mike & Mike deliver the clue.) My greatest inspirational moment ever was Lou Gehrig's farewell speech at Yankee Stadium in 1939, talk about class
Yes, very, very classy, but for pure inspiration, I'll take this coach telling his Notre Dame team to "win one for the Gipper" & then rallying to defeat Army in 1928

Paper can be used to illustrate an architectural concept; holding the edge doesn\'t inspire much confidence in its structural integrity, but curve it, & you get one of these projecting structures with a simple machine in its name')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew does a demonstration with a piece of paper.) Paper can be used to illustrate an architectural concept; holding the edge doesn't inspire much confidence in its structural integrity, but curve it, & you get one of these projecting structures with a simple machine in its name

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Alex: [*] is right, and if ever Jeopardy! goes to a two-host format, I recommend Mike & Mike. Those guys are fun. All right, less than a minute to go now, Joe.)

')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_DJ_6_5', 'clue_DJ_6_5_stuck', '(Mike & Mike deliver the clue.) One of the greatest coaches ever has got to be Phil Jackson; he\'s won 11 titles, something even Red Auerbach couldn\'t do

Yeah, Phil\'s a legend, no doubt about it, but I\'ll pick this college basketball wizard who won 10 men\'s NCAA titles from 1964 to 1975')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
(Mike & Mike deliver the clue.) One of the greatest coaches ever has got to be Phil Jackson; he's won 11 titles, something even Red Auerbach couldn't do
Yeah, Phil's a legend, no doubt about it, but I'll pick this college basketball wizard who won 10 men's NCAA titles from 1964 to 1975

$7,001
Bolivia')
